Time management: The writer may struggle to manage their time effectively, leading to missed deadlines and a rushed article that does not meet the standards of an award-winning piece.
Research: The writer may have difficulty finding reliable sources or may not conduct thorough research, leading to inaccuracies or misinformation in the article.
Editing: The writer may struggle to edit their work effectively, leading to grammatical errors, inconsistencies, and other issues that detract from the overall quality of the article.
Topic selection: The writer may have difficulty selecting a topic that is both relevant and interesting to the target audience, leading to an article that does not resonate with readers.
Word choice: The writer may struggle to choose the right words to convey their message effectively, leading to an article that is unclear or unengaging.
